main event: An Air Force officer observed a bullet-shaped shiny object over Truk Atoll in the Pacific on February 6, 1953.
interesting points: The object was estimated to travel at 150 mph and at an altitude of 100 to 500 feet., The object appeared to be larger than a C-47 aircraft and had a shiny metallic appearance., The object did not leave any trail or indication of flight., A Japanese fishing crew reported a bright reddish-orange light moving quickly across the sky on February 7, 1953., The fishing crew expressed fear during the sighting and quickly retrieved their gear to return home.
sighted object: a bullet-shaped shiny object and a bright reddish-orange light
witness description: An Air Force officer and a Japanese fishing crew
